conversation: Landlord

Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly trash report. John took out 0 units of trash. Kate took out 56 units of trash. Jack took out 30 units of trash. Emma took out 4 units of trash. Luke took out 10 units of trash.
John

Uh, guys, I know taking out trash is a hassle, but come on, I didn't take out any trash this month. Can we please talk about this? I feel like we're all just taking out the bare minimum and it's not fair to the rest of us. Maybe we can work together to figure out a better system for taking out trash?
Kate

Hey John, I totally understand where you're coming from. I mean, taking out trash is the worst, but we all benefit from having a clean and hygienic living space, right? Maybe we could set up a schedule or something, so we're all taking out trash at different times and not all at once? Like, I could take out 75 units one week, and then Jack could take out 30 units the next week, and so on. That way, we're all contributing equally, but not all at the same time. What do you think?
Emma

Hey Kate, that's a great idea! I think setting up a schedule would be super helpful. I'd be happy to take out trash more frequently if it means we can all avoid taking out a huge amount at once. Plus, it would be nice to have some consistency and not have to worry about the trash piling up. What do you think, John? Would you be down for a schedule?
John

Hey Kate and Emma, I completely agree with you both. A schedule would be amazing, and it would make taking out trash so much more manageable. I'm down to take out trash more frequently if it means we can all avoid taking out a huge amount at once. Plus, it would be nice to have some consistency and not have to worry about the trash piling up. Let's work together to figure out a schedule that works for everyone.
Luke

Hey guys, I think we're all on the same page here. A schedule would be super helpful, and I'm down to take out trash more frequently if it means we can all avoid taking out a huge amount at once.
